Description: Blue glazed composition (faience) double flask or jar; mould-made and glazed; twin ovoid bodies with pointed bases, the two vessels joined for much of their length; a short cylindrical neck survives on one of the vessels, the other is broken away at the shoulder; covered witha turquoise glaze, decorated with a black band on one side.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Turner Bequest Excavations, Amathus
Curator's comments: Bibliography: Peltenburg E. 2002, 'East Mediterranean faience: Changing patterns of production and exchange at the end of the 2nd Millennium BC', in eds E. Braun-Holzinger and H. Matthäus, Die nahöstlichen Kulturen und Griechenland an der Wende vom 2. zum 1. Jahrtausend v. Chr. (Möhnesee), 75-108 (esp. 85-6) (with further references).
Bibliographic references: Murray, Smith and Walters 1900 / Excavations in Cyprus (p.116, site A, tomb 8)
